post.title: Agenda et actualités
post.text: Actualités La guerre Elle a commencé le 4 novembre 2020 Table des matières 1. Derniers événements 2. Petit résumé historique3. Quelques liens 1. Derniers événements17/01/21Besoins urgents au Tigré selon AP news4,5 millions de personnes ont besoin d’une aide d’urgence  Extraits du rapport de EEPADelivery of water has been difficult as water trucks and missionaries are looted. A flow of IDPs is observed “coming into Mekelle and other major towns” showing “how much desperate” people are to get “humanitarian access”. Their produce and household materials are vandalised or burned. The humanitarian administrators can not go back to regional offices without food as “people are starving” and they will be in trouble “if they go with empty hands”. The Central Zone interim administrator states that “the situation on the ground is dire”. It is explained that “food and non-food items or other livelihoods are either looted or destroyed.”  The Central Zone administrator warns that “hundreds of thousands” may “starve to death”, if urgent emergency assistance is not dispatched. 		The humanitarian organisations do not have an adequate number of trucks for transportation. During the war all trucks from the region were allegedly looted and driven to Addis Ababa. To transport the required food ratios to 4.5 million people more than 2000 trucks are now urgently required. 16/01/21Extraits du rapport de EEPADuring the last three days, there has been heavy fighting in Daero Hafash (East of Axum) where four battalions of Ethiopian National Defense Forces (ENDF) and Eritrean Defense Forces (ErDF) were “totally destroyed” by Tigray forces. It is reported that Tigray forces captured “lots of weapons”. The Tigray regional government issued a statement today: "The government of Tigray has confirmed that Tegadalay Syoum Mesfin, Abay Tsehaye and Asmelash Weldeselassie were not in the war front due to their ages and health issues. Therefore, they are assassinated by Abiy Ahmed and Eritrean forces, very likely at the order of Isayas." Brigadier-General Tesfaye Ayalew, Head of the ENDF Deployment Department, states: “Even if there may be good people amongst them (Tigrayans) we can’t differentiate the good from the bad. To save the country we made it so that they (Tigrayans) were excluded from doing the work.” Reported that Beijing is “extremely angry” at PM Abiy for the killing of Seyoum Mesfin, the former Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ethiopia. Seyoum “was respected in policy circles. He was the architect of Ethiopia's strategic partnership with China that spawned a vast infrastructure renewal in Ethiopia.” 15/01/21Des centaines de soldats érythréens sont encore arrivés aujourd'hui à Makelle.  deux documents arrivés ce jour.   1. Le procès-verbal non publié de la réunion du 8 janvier du groupe de coordination d'urgence pour le Tigré. Notre contact l'a envoyé dans ces couleurs, des lettres blanches sur fond rouge, car il voulait souligner l'urgence. il s'agit du compte-rendu d'une réunion organisée par l’ Emergency Coordination Cluster (ECC) de l'ONU et différentes organisations humanitaires présentes au Tigré (MSF, Croix-Rouge, CRS, Norwegian Church Aid etc. Le compte-rendu documente que plusieurs administrateurs appartenant au gouvernement de transition du Tigré ont participé à la réunion. Ce qui est rapporté est catastrophique. Des gens meurent dans la rue. Très peu de choses sont faites en dehors de Mekelle. "Nous ne sommes pas en mesure d'atteindre 99% des personnes dans le besoin".  2. Tout juste sorti, en termes diplomatique, mais sans langue de bois, un message de Josep Borrell, responsable des affaires étrangères de l’UE, très inquiet, lui aussi :  On y trouve une confirmation écrite de l'UE selon laquelle il y a bien des troupes érythréennes au Tigré, ce dont plus grand monde ne doute aujourd’hui. Le premier ministre éthiopien proclamait vouloir arrêter une clique de 12 criminels, mais le TPLF comptait plus de 500.000 membres. Combien de dizaines de milliers de morts et d’emprisonnés à ce jour?  Un hommage touchant du directeur de la World Peace Foundation à Seyum Fesfin, qui vient d’être abattu, à 71 ans, plutôt que de se rendre, de façon arrogante, selon la télévision éthiopienne.      Extraits du rapport de EEPA  Asena TV shows images of four to six explosions outside the municipality offices in the centre of Addis Ababa, which were followed with a few shots. A video emerged of the massacre at the Aksum Church of Maryam Zion, where at least 750 civilians were allegedly killed by Eritrean troops. The video shows a body taken away by a priest and shows the I.D. cart found on the body. EEPA reported that the massacre took place on 15 Dec., that civilians were hiding in the church and had been ordered out onto the square, before being executed. The Catholic Bishop of Adigrat (Tigray), Abune Tesfaselassie Medhin, sent an appeal (dated 5 Jan 2021) stating that the people, including Eritrean refugees, have “run out of food items, basic life-saving medicines, water, etc., and have no access to essential services.” The Bishop states “millions” of people have been displaced, most of them women and children without food and water to escape from “heavy artillery and air-strikes.” The Bishop calls on humanitarian assistance to respond to the “war-induced” humanitarian crisis in Tigray. Many of the areas have still not been reached by aid organisations. In the last days, there has been fighting again around the Hitsats camp for Eritrean refugees. Eritrean soldiers killed many Eritrean refugees and took some of them to Eritrea. Some refugees escaped to the Adi Harush camp. A woman testified that in the flight from Hitsats to Adi Harush, 3 persons died. It is reported that banks are the first target to be looted by Eritrean soldiers.  14/01/21 Avis inquiet de OCHA  Extraits du rapport de EEPA o	ENDF states it has killed three members of the leadership of TPLF who held high office in Ethiopia: Seyoum Mesfin, foreign minister of Ethiopia from 1991 until 2010; Abay Tsehaye, former Federal Affairs Minister and Asmelash Woldesellassie, ex-parliamentary chief whip of the Ethiopian Parliament.  o	The Ethiopian Government is arresting former retired Tigrayan officials and their spouses. Many of those are said to be arrested from their houses in Mekelle. Official reports make it appear as if they were captured in battle. It is reported that this is not true.  o	The ancient Monastery of Debre Damo in Tigray was bombarded by Eritrean soldiers using heavy artillery. Debre Damo, is the name of a flat-topped mountain, or amba , and a 6th-century monastery in Tigray, Ethiopia. The mountain is a steeply rising plateau about 1000 by 400 m in dimension.  o	The monasteries’ church artifacts and materials were looted by Eritrean forces.  13/01/21 Seyoum Mesfin venait d'un petit village non loin d'Adigrat, Azeba. Il a été Ministre des affaires étrangères. On annonce qu'on vient de le tuer. ainsi que beaucoup d'autres, comme  Asmelash Woldesellassie, qui était aveugle.  Brig. Gen. Tesfaye Ayalew of ENDF said that former FM Seyoum Mesfin; former TPLF Exec. Member & long serving TPLF/EPRDF politician, Abay Tsehaye; & current TPLF executive member & former Government whip, Asmelash Woldesellassie, were all killed.  La situation selon OCHA  MSF au Tigré  …des dizaines de milliers de personnes déplacées vivent dans des bâtiments abandonnés et sur des chantiers de construction dans le nord-ouest et l'ouest de la région, autour des villes de Shire, Dansha et Humera …Ces personnes n'ont qu'un accès très limité à la nourriture, à l'eau potable, aux abris et aux soins de santé. It was hard to take proper care of those wounded by the artillery due to a critical shortage of medical supplies. There are reports of looting of ritual books and other artifacts from remote monasteries in Tigray. These are being transported to Eritrea. According to an analyst, the entire leadership of the TPLF is intact. Over 70 of them have retreated to the mountains. Only two have been arrested.  Reported situation in Ethiopia (as confirmed per 21 December) Fighting between Amhara and Afar militias is taking place in Wollo Province. 20/12/20 Une équipe de la VRT a pu aller jusque Shire, dans l’ouest du Tigré. Des villes avec d’importants dégats et pillées, des villages désertés, des céréales non récoltées, des morts le long des routes, des besoins vitaux indispensables...     https://www.vrt.be/vrtnws/nl/2020/12/20/vrtnws-als-eerste-in-oosten-van-tigray-in-ethiopie-het-geweld/ Extraits du rapport de EEPAA report based on testimonials of three Egyptian officials and one European diplomat indicates that the UAE used its base in Assab (Eritrea) to launch drones strikes against Tigray. The investigative platform Bellingcat confirmed the presence of Chinese-produced drones at the UAE’s military base in Assab, Eritrea. Sudan has reportedly captured Eritrean soldiers dressed in Amhara militia uniforms fighting along the Sudan border alongside Amhara special forces. A foreign diplomat has stated that “thousands” of Eritrean soldiers are engaged in Tigray. Two diplomats stated that Eritrean troops entered Ethiopia through three northern border towns: Zalambessa, Rama and Badme. Killings occurred in Edaga Hamus, a small town in Tigray. Eritrean soldiers reportedly killed approximately 150 civilians, including a priest and women seeking refuge in a church, located 4 km to the west of Marieam Dengelat. The town and some rural villages (Maimegelta, Dengelat, Tsa'a and Hangoda) are under the control of Eritrean forces. The military is slaughtering the animals. People are starving to death. Eritrean soldiers were in Mekelle (Tigray), according to a resident and two diplomats receiving information from the ground. They state that some soldiers were wearing Eritrean uniforms, whilst others wore Ethiopian uniforms but “spoke Tigrinya with an Eritrean accent and drove trucks without license plates.” There are multiple reports that the Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) are looting property from the Sur Company and transporting the loot to Addis Ababa. A deacon and 15 civilians were killed by Eritrean and ENDF soldiers in Adigrat while trying to protect the Addis Pharmaceutical Factory from looting.The UN reports that many Tigray people have no access to food, water, cash, power and telecommunications Ethnic profiling of Tigray continues. A prominent Tigrayan activist and lawyer living in Addis Ababa, was detained on Saturday by Ethiopian police. A former TV Tigray employee and several priests of Tigrayan ethnic origins were also reportedly arrested. Another Tigrayan, an Ethiopian Airlines employee was arrested last week 19/12/20 On parle de  plus de 150 civils, y compris des  femmes et des enfants, massacrés par des Erythréens à Maryam Dengelat , dans une église où ils s’étaient réfugiés.Maryam Dengelat est un petit coin de paradis dans la montagne, où je m’étais souvent rendu. Je connaissais bien Aba Kindeya (qui avait perdu 9 de ses 10 enfants) et sa petite fille (voir photo) qui habitaient juste à côté de l’église et de la source d’eau.    18/12/20 Extrait du rapport de l'EEPANine priests killed in the Church in Adi Aweshi, Tembien, Tigray, by Ethiopian and Eritrean troops.17/12/20 Tigray crisis: How Ethiopian doctors fled militia attackshttps://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-55236354 Division au conseil de sécurité https://www.rfi.fr/fr/afrique/20201215-conflit-en-%C3%A9thiopie-le-conseil-de-s%C3%A9curit%C3%A9-divis%C3%A9 Extrait du rapport de l'EEPAAccording to former Minister of Defense from Eritrea, Mesfin Hagos, Eritrea deployed in Tigray 17 infantry and mechanized divisions, a brigade and commando division and TPLF claims that Eritrean technical and combat units also participated (the 11th, 17th, 19th, 26th, 27th, 28th, 52rd, 53rd infantry and 42nd, 46th, 48th and 49th mechanized divisions and 2nd brigade and 52nd com mando division). AFP reports that the Federal Ethiopian army separated men and women and executed a group of men in the village of Bisober in Southern Tigray on November 14th. In Tembien, Adi Qeweylo, Tigray, nine priests were killed by Federal Ethiopian and Eritrean troops. Reports of looting continue to come in. Eritrean soldiers are said to continue plundering valuable equipment from factories and universities. Videos have come out of what the descriptions claim are Eritrean trucks in Shire Endasilasie carrying loot back to Eritrea. Social media reports state that Eritrean soldiers may be engaged in “massive looting” of cultural artifacts. This could include raids on remote monasteries which keep ancient manuscripts. Ancient Christian religious manuscripts and texts may be in danger. Calls on UNESCO to investigate. 16/12/20 Extrait du rapport de l'EEPAHundreds of civilians died in bombardements of Wukro and Tembien. Heavy fighting took place, heavy shelling has been reported. Bombardements are partly carried out by drones. Reportedly Eritrean soldiers are also wearing Ethiopian army uniforms. Kidnapping of wealthy Tigrayan business from Tigray by Eritrean Troops near Adigrat reported. Voices increasing on social media that systematic starvation is used as a weapon of war in Tigray and that UN Security Council needs to step in. Over 200 people have reportedly been killed in Wukro and the town is now deserted.The European Union has stopped budgetary financial support, worth 90 million euros, to Ethiopia. The move came after a series of serious human rights abuses in the Tigray region. Food and water shortages in Mekelle. Banks are closed. The UN states that 2.3 million children have been cut from aid in Tigray. 15/12/20 La Belgique suspend son aide au gouvernement éthiopien  AFP reporting on Ethiopian army executing a group of men in the village of Bisober in Southern Tigray on November 14th.We heared from witnesses about similar executions of civilians taking place in the Wukro area during November 25th -29th.Wukro is apparantly completely deserted now, with almost the entire population who fled the town.https://au.news.yahoo.com/terrified-survivors-recount-attacks-civilians-030108107.html Extrait du rapport de l'EEPAReported that fighting in Tigray is ongoing in Hagere Selam, between Wukro and Adigrat, Samre, Dogu’a and Kolla Tembien, May Tsemre, and around Maychew. Catholic Church and elders in Eritrea have asked Eritreans not to purchase (cheap) goods originating from Tigray. This follows after many reports of heavy plundering in Tigray, especially by Eritrean forces. Many of these were transported to Eritrea. Goods looted from Tigray are stocked outside of Asmara, in Ashagolgol: a military area. The UN Security Council has met to discuss the conflict in Tigray. The conversation was initiated by Belgium, Estonia, France, Germany, the US, and the UK. At the UN SC, Belgium expressed its concern over the situation in Ethiopia and called for respect for humanitarian law and unhindered access of humanitarian workers to all areas. 14/12/20Toujours aucune nouvelle d’Adigrat.  Il y avait de l’électricité ce jour à Makelle. Les moulins ont tourné à plein rendement.  En fait, la famille a passé une semaine à Samre et ils ont vu les bombardements de près. Les enfants en sont toujours traumatisés et la fille de Filmon ne dort plus.  Ils ont mis trois jours pour en revenir à pied, en pleine guerre. Souvent, Mbete disait : je n’en peux plus, continuez sans moi, je peux mourir ici ! » Elle passe maintenant une part importante de son temps à l’église.  Selon Martin Plaut, The Catholic Church in Eritrea has asked its faithful not to purchase any of the things coming from Tigray after the widespread looting. Goods are being stored just outside of Asmara at Ashagolgol, a military area Des pillards auraient tenté de voler un appareil à dialyse à l’hôpital de Makelle. Une vingtaine de jeunes auraient tenté de s’opposer. Ils auraient été tous abattus.    Il y aurait toujours de violents combats du côté de Tembien et Hagere Salam. 13/12/20 Parfois, des communications téléphoniques avec Makelle sont possibles, mais les batteries des GSM sont à plat. Pas moyen de les recharger: pas d’électricité, pas de combustible pour les générateurs.  Grâce à notre neveu Yonathan toujours à Addis, via un ami à lui, nous avons pu, cette nuit, entrer en communication avec notre soeur Alem Tsehay et Embachew, son mari.   Dès la coupure d’électricité, Alem Tsehay a acheté un mogogo (four) à bois, pour préparer l’injera et le pain (kitcha). Cela dépanne aussi les voisines qui apportent dans la mesure du possible leur contribution en bois ou en charbon de bois.  Devant l’ultimatum de l’armée éthiopienne, Alem Tsehay et toute la famille, y compris Edynia, ses deux petits enfants bébés et Mbete, sa belle-mère et une vingtaine de proches, sont partis dans un camion Isuzu, vers Samre, avec autant de matériel que possible. Embachew préférait mourir chez lui et il resta seul à Makelle. La nuit, Samre a été bombardé. Au matin, ils ont décidé de retourner tous à Makelle à pied, avec la vieille Mbete, abandonnant tout leur matériel sur place… Cela leur a pris deux jours de marche. Ils ont passé la nuit dans une église. A Makelle, beaucoup de pillages, surtout chez les commerçants et les négociants, ce qui aggrave les pénuries alimentaires. Les prix explosent.  Un manque criant d’eau. il faut utiliser les bouteilles d’eau commerciales pour la cuisine. Quand on a un peu de grain, on ne peut pas forcément l’utiliser, vu le manque de moulin.  Les gens passent beaucoup de temps à prier dans les églises. Un ami était parti du côté de Tembien, mais là, les bombardements ont été terribles. Makonnen, le frère d’Embachew, a du rejoindre le TFLF. Notre neveu Geitahun aussi, probablement. Ils n’ont pas de nouvelles d’Adigrat.  Les étudiants non tigréens de l’Université de Makelle ont pu rejoindre Addis Abeba.   Extrait du rapport de l'EEPABombardment of civilians and areas of TDF suspected bases were reported using drones and fighter jets around Central fronts of Tigray. Reports of three convoys of military trucks carrying soldiers and three trucks which were heading to supply fuel to Ethiopian National Defence Forces (ENDF) have been destroyed by Tigray Defence Forces around Mayichaw, the capital of Southern Zone of Tigray. Alerts on frequent bombing of Tembien (Tigray) with increasing number of confirmations, speaking of indiscriminate attacks, taking place “nonstop all day today involving a huge number of fighter jets and artillery firepower” Massacre reported in Tembien, a small town of Guya, around 30km west of Abyiadi town where more than 20 civilians are slaughtered by the military according to reports. Soldiers brought by helicopter to Tembien are terrorising civilians to give up the location of the elected President of the Tigray regional government, reported. U.S. State Department warns any Eritrean forces in Ethiopia to withdraw, after finding reports of their presence there to be ‘credible’. The young woman and athlete, Letesenbet Gidey, originally from Tigray, world record holder of 5,000 meters was supposed to participate in the half marathon that took place in Valencia, Spain, last Sunday. Gidey never reached her destination.Ethnic profiling of Tigrians in Addis Ababa traffic police management, Addis Ababa police as well as federal police was reported, including arrest of those suspected and others were told they will be forcibly sent to military training (Estimated to be 200). Ethinic profiling, harassment and arrest of family members of former and current TPLF leaders reported in Addis Ababa, incl family of Ambassador Seyoum Mesfin and Sekoture Getachaw. Ethnic profiling of Tigrians living in low cost government owned houses in Addis Ababa. NYT reports that ethnic Tigrayans in Ethiopia are “treated like criminal suspects and subjected to various forms of discrimination, harassment and abuse by government officials.” Reports include “being detained without charges, put under house arrest, and barred from traveling outside the country. Tigrayans say they have had their businesses shut down, homes ransacked and money extorted by security officials.” Reported from within Tigray: serious problem of lack of water. Serious looting still ongoing from shops in Mekelle, perpetrated by Amharic militia and Eritreans as well as poverty stricken people benefiting from the lawless situation. 12/12/20Première bonne nouvelle. Un convoi du CICR est arrivé à Makelle  Quelques nouvelles de quelqu’un qui a quitté Makelle jeudi, avec des étudiants non tigréens de l’Université.   Beaucoup de pillages, surtout chez les commerçants et les négociants. Je ne sais s’il s’agit de milices amharas, érythréennes ou simplement de paysans pauvres des alentours qui profitent de l’absence de police… Un manque criant d’eau. il faut utiliser les bouteilles d’eau commerciales pour la cuisine.La nourriture se raréfie, surtout le bêrêbêrê.Dès la coupure d’électricité, Alem Tsehay est partie pour acheter un mogogo (four) à bois, pour préparer De temps en temps, les communications téléphoniques fonctionnent. A condition que les batteries ne soient pas à plat. As War Goes On in Ethiopia, Ethnic Harassment Is on the Risehttps://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/12/world/africa/Ethiopia-Tigray-ethnic.html 11/12/20 Extraits du rapport de l'EEPAThe New York Times has reported testimonies of Ethiopian refugees in Sudan. They tell stories about ethnic massacres in Tigray. They mostly blame government aligned militias. Report that 10,000 Eritrean refugees in Tigray have been forcefully returned to Eritrea. In an interview with the BBC, two Tigray-based ENDF soldiers report that their base was attacked by TPLF forces on 3 november. The battle lasted 11 hours after which they surrendered. The TPLF transported them to the border. The soldiers say that their wounded were not treated. 10/12/20 Extraits du rapport de l'EEPAFurther evidence of ethnic profiling emerging as business owners of Tigray origins are being harassed in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, in a leaked memo with proof of profiling and targeting specific businesses of Tigray origins. One million out of six million residents have fled their homes in Tigray as a result of the conflict. 9/12/20 Fleeing Ethiopians Tell of Ethnic Massacres in Tigray Warhttps://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/09/world/africa/ethiopia-tigray-sudan.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article https://www.awashpost.com/2020/12/03/the-eritrean-factor-isaias-afwerkis-meddling-is-complicating-the-civil-war-in-ethiopia/ 6/12/20 https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-55145827https://www.bbc.com/news/topics/cr2pnx1173dt/tigray-crisis Un responsable du TPLF parle de dizaines de milliers de morts dans un interviewhttps://m.facebook.com/watch/?v=143268743876759&_rdr   Le témoignage du Dr Tedros de Humera (2’10)https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/w172x2z2d5prcjz 4/12/20 Des camions arriveraient de la région amhara et d’Erythrée pour emmener le fruit des pillages. Les habitants sont très démunis On parle de Tesfay sur cette page de Wikipedia : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EthioTrees Notre amie Regbe (en Amérique) a reçu un message de sa soeur Lemlem, qui a reçu un bref message de leur soeur Freweini à Makelle ( amie aussi d’Almaz, nominée femme de l’année par CNN): « ne te tracasse pas » («adjouri », typiquement tigréen) https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-ethiopia-conflict-idUKKBN28E140 3/12/20Des rumeurs de massacres et des pillages en différents endroitsUne source proche parle de 85 morts à Workamba (à 100 km de Makelle) 2/12/20Des problèmes d’approvisionnement de nourriture et même d’eau , entre autres dans les camps de réfugiés Almaz dit qu’on se bat autour de MakelleSuite au bombardement, Un nombre de visites quotidiennes  multiplié par 1000 sur la page "Hagere salam", de Wikipedia, créée par Jan Les Nations Unies auraient négocié avec le gouvernement un couloir humanitaire MSF Espagne va essayer d’intervenir auprès des réfugiés arrivant en pays afarL'union européenne menace de sanctions Message de Jef de ce matin "Bonjour André,Non, aucun image de la ville de Mekelle depuis que les ENDF seraient arrivé.Ce que nous comprenons, c’est qu’ils ont pris contrôle de l’aéroport mais attendent l’arrivée de renforts avant de essayer d’occuper la ville elle-même.Entretemps, Nations Unies nous disent que la situation humanitaire dans plusieurs villes du Tigré est en train de devenir dramatique,..." 1/12/20Des Tigréens, avec des Erythréens, ont manifesté rue de la Loi ce jour, contre la guerre. Près de 500 personnes selon les organisateurs.  Abiy, avec la prise de Makelle, après avoir bombardé des villes, une usine de médicaments, et d’autres cibles, crie victoire. Mais a-t-il attrapé un seul de la clique de 12 personnes, ce qui était son unique objectif?  On parle de pillages par des Erythréens du côté d’Adigrat.On s’inquiète du sort d’autres Erythéens, ceux qui étaient réfugiés au Tigré, emmenés…  Plus inquiétant encore. L’armée dit avoir pris Makelle, mais pourquoi aucune image à la TV éthiopienne. Est-ce parce qu’ils n’y sont pas, ou faut-il imaginer le pire? 29/11/20 De lourds bombardements à Makelle hier et ce matin, entre autres non loin de l’hôpitalun rapport du CICR parle d’un hôpital complètement débordé et à court de matérielun avion (érythréen?) abattu par le TPLF après avoir bombardé Hagere Salamle TPLF dit que toutes les usines, y compris la cimenterie de Makelle et l’usine de médicaments de Makelle ont été détruitesAbiy a dit hier qu’il contrôlait Makelle, prématurément sans doute, mais n’était-ce pas juste pour dire à la délégation de l’OUA : « c’est fini, il n’y a plus rien à voir, vous pouvez rentrer » (hypothèse personnelle)Un rapport d’une organisation qui fait du développement en pays afar qui parlait de violents combats à leur frontière et de corps massacrés (essentiellement des vieux, des femmes, des enfants) à Chercher, une petite bourgade de gens très joviaux, des Rayas.  25/11/20 L'appel d'un de nos partenaires de Makelle  "Dear all Tesfay familyAs you all are aware of what is going on in Tigray. please move to let the world know what the eritrean troops are doing in Tigray......please ..the world is bliend and is not see or not careful to prevent the killing bombing ..creating fear among civilians through the media.No internet, no transportation to or from Tigray and this is creating a shortage of supply, particularly food and medical items. over 1.3 million are displaced from their places and no corridor opened for humanitarian assistance.what is happening is beyond words ..........and it is heartbreaking to see a great country is collapsing of the madness of two people.I am not able and feel hopeless for not knowing of our 90 children in addigrat and the staff too.Ohhhhhhhh GOD ! Please inform Almaze all families in mekelle are okey...and tell Almaze to send me her telegram.Yirga" 17/11/20Un appel de scientifiques flamands  Notre appel du 11/11/20 Le Tigray a connu la guerre de 1974 à 1991.Il était au coeur de la famine qui frappa l’Ethiopie en 1984-1985.Je l’ai ainsi connu, en guerre, en 1987 et 1988. En 1991, j’ai vu la paix fleurir, et, depuis lors, la reconstruction, admirable, l’allongement de 20 ans de l’espérance de vie de ses habitants…  Ces derniers mois, les récoltes ont été ravagées par des invasions de sauterelles.   Et puis, en ce mois de novembre 2011, c’est la guerre, terrible et meurtrière, entre les forces gouvernementales et les forces régionales, avec une implication possible de l’Erythrée...  Un nouveau drame de très grande ampleur menace.  Pourquoi ce silence des médias, et à peine plus qu’un murmure des instances internationales, pour pousser au dialogue, à la négociation?  Que pouvons-nous faire?  Pouvez-vous transmettre ce message si vous connaissez un journaliste, un représentant politique...  D’avance, merci pour eux.  (Nous avons reçu de nombreuses réponses, qui nous ont permis d'être en contact avec des représentants politiques, des journalistes et de grosses ONG ) 2. Petit résumé historique.  En 1974, une junte militaire profita de manifestations au départ menées par des étudiants pour renverser l’Empereur et mettre en place une dictature sanguinaire, le Derg.  En 1984-1985, une famine fit près de 1 million de morts dans le nord de l’Ethiopie.    Une guérilla s’organisa au Tigrée, d'où émergea le TPLF qui contribua à renverser la dictature en 1991. Peu après,

link: https://eeas.europa.eu/headquarters/headquarters-Homepage_en/91459/ We need humanitarian access to Tigray as urgent first step towards peace in Ethiopia
https://www.reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/Ethiopia - Tigray Region Humanitarian Update - Situation Report No. 2 (11 November 2020).pdf

post.title: Alexei Navalny: Russia’s charismatic anti-Putin campaigner – Times of India
post.text:
MOSCOW: A charismatic anti-corruption campaigner, Alexei Navalny has been Russia’s leading opposition politician for around a decade, determined to challenge Vladimir Putin‘s grip on power despite frequent prison stays and harm to his health.  The Yale-educated 44-year-old lawyer — who has said he will return to Russia from Germany on Sunday after treatment there for a poisoning attack in Siberia — has been banned from state television and was barred from challenging Putin in the 2018 presidential election.  Despite being frequently jailed and physically attacked, he has vowed to continue in politics after being poisoned with the Novichok nerve agent in August.  In a video announcing his return, Navalny said he was “almost healthy” and can continue recovering at home after a poisoning he insists was carried out by Russia’s domestic security agency, the Federal Security Service (FSB), on Putin’s orders.  Navalny has won a young fan base through viral videos exposing corruption among the elites and has more than two million followers on Twitter.  He has grabbed attention with his uncompromising rhetoric and coined phrases such as the “party of crooks and thieves” to slam the ruling United Russia party.  In 2011, the anti-corruption blogger led mass protests when tens of thousands took to the streets of Moscow to protest vote-rigging in parliamentary elections.  Two years later the father of two stood for Moscow mayor, coming second against Putin ally Sergei Sobyanin.  In 2017, he accused then-prime minister Dmitry Medvedev of massive corruption in a YouTube documentary. That kick-started a fresh wave of protests across the country that was met with police violence and mass arrests.  The same year he had to travel to Spain for surgery after one of several street attacks left him nearly blind in one eye.  Navalny has faced a series of legal cases, which supporters see as punishment for his activism.  In 2013, he was found guilty in an embezzlement case involving a timber deal and given a five-year suspended sentence that disqualified him from running in elections.  In 2014, he was given another suspended sentence, and his brother Oleg, a co-defendant, was jailed for three-and-a-half years in a decision activists likened to a “hostage-taking”.  On Monday, papers were filed with a Moscow court asking for that suspended sentence to be converted into jail time, a move Navalny’s allies say is an attempt to block his return to Russia.  With the Kremlin tightly controlling the media, Navalny remains a fringe figure for many Russians, who are exposed to the official portrayal of him as a Western stooge and convicted criminal.  Putin has refused to pronounce Navalny’s name in public, instead referring to him as “the person you mentioned”, among other euphemisms, when asked directly about the opposition leader.  While barred from mainstream politics, Navalny has sought to expose the lavish wealth of Russia’s elites, broadcasting the findings of his investigations to millions of Russians on social media and YouTube.  In his latest expose, Navalny last month phoned a man he said was an FSB agent involved with his poisoning, who appeared to admit to the attack during the call.  But despite tapping into discontent among a largely young urban middle class he is far from a unifying opposition figure, and some have criticised his anti-immigrant nationalist stance.  He scored his biggest recent political success in local elections in 2019, when pro-Putin parties suffered major losses because of a “Smart Voting” plan Navalny put forward after his allies were barred from standing in numerous races.  The tactic calls for voters to support the one candidate most likely to defeat the ruling party and saw Kremlin-linked candidates drop seats in the Moscow assembly.  Navalny’s offices have been raided repeatedly since, while his Anti-Corruption Foundation was declared a “foreign agent” and ordered to pay several large fines.

post.author: Mainak Ghosh
post.title: Alexei Navalny: Russia’s charismatic anti-Putin campaigner – Times of India
post.text:
MOSCOW: A charismatic anti-corruption campaigner, Alexei Navalny has been Russia’s leading opposition politician for around a decade, determined to challenge Vladimir Putin‘s grip on power despite frequent prison stays and harm to his health.  The Yale-educated 44-year-old lawyer — who has said he will return to Russia from Germany on Sunday after treatment there for a poisoning attack in Siberia — has been banned from state television and was barred from challenging Putin in the 2018 presidential election.  Despite being frequently jailed and physically attacked, he has vowed to continue in politics after being poisoned with the Novichok nerve agent in August.  In a video announcing his return, Navalny said he was “almost healthy” and can continue recovering at home after a poisoning he insists was carried out by Russia’s domestic security agency, the Federal Security Service (FSB), on Putin’s orders.  Navalny has won a young fan base through viral videos exposing corruption among the elites and has more than two million followers on Twitter.  He has grabbed attention with his uncompromising rhetoric and coined phrases such as the “party of crooks and thieves” to slam the ruling United Russia party.  In 2011, the anti-corruption blogger led mass protests when tens of thousands took to the streets of Moscow to protest vote-rigging in parliamentary elections.  Two years later the father of two stood for Moscow mayor, coming second against Putin ally Sergei Sobyanin.  In 2017, he accused then-prime minister Dmitry Medvedev of massive corruption in a YouTube documentary. That kick-started a fresh wave of protests across the country that was met with police violence and mass arrests.  The same year he had to travel to Spain for surgery after one of several street attacks left him nearly blind in one eye.  Navalny has faced a series of legal cases, which supporters see as punishment for his activism.  In 2013, he was found guilty in an embezzlement case involving a timber deal and given a five-year suspended sentence that disqualified him from running in elections.  In 2014, he was given another suspended sentence, and his brother Oleg, a co-defendant, was jailed for three-and-a-half years in a decision activists likened to a “hostage-taking”.  On Monday, papers were filed with a Moscow court asking for that suspended sentence to be converted into jail time, a move Navalny’s allies say is an attempt to block his return to Russia.  With the Kremlin tightly controlling the media, Navalny remains a fringe figure for many Russians, who are exposed to the official portrayal of him as a Western stooge and convicted criminal.  Putin has refused to pronounce Navalny’s name in public, instead referring to him as “the person you mentioned”, among other euphemisms, when asked directly about the opposition leader.  While barred from mainstream politics, Navalny has sought to expose the lavish wealth of Russia’s elites, broadcasting the findings of his investigations to millions of Russians on social media and YouTube.  In his latest expose, Navalny last month phoned a man he said was an FSB agent involved with his poisoning, who appeared to admit to the attack during the call.  But despite tapping into discontent among a largely young urban middle class he is far from a unifying opposition figure, and some have criticised his anti-immigrant nationalist stance.  He scored his biggest recent political success in local elections in 2019, when pro-Putin parties suffered major losses because of a “Smart Voting” plan Navalny put forward after his allies were barred from standing in numerous races.  The tactic calls for voters to support the one candidate most likely to defeat the ruling party and saw Kremlin-linked candidates drop seats in the Moscow assembly.  Navalny’s offices have been raided repeatedly since, while his Anti-Corruption Foundation was declared a “foreign agent” and ordered to pay several large fines.

post.title: Time for Free Medicare for all in America.
post.text: It has puzzeled me for decades: How is it possible?..’ Time for Free Medicare for all in America.Finally, the richest country on earth, appears to have seen the light. It is better late than never. Photo:https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.counterpunch.org%2F2018%2F08%2F29%2Fimproved-medicare-for-all-becoming-unstoppable%2F&psig=AOvVaw2fgx3NTioEnWHHU9vBaSeS&ust=1610983713583000&source=images&cd=vfe&ved=0CAMQjB1qFwoTCLCvuayko-4CFQAAAAAdAAAAABAtThe recent electoral victory of the Dems, and the desprestige reached by a GOP, deeply imbued by Trump, really has smoothed the ground for implementing in the U.S. an aspiration of most Americans, claimed astonishing solitarily for years by the left, in view of the short-sighted vision of the two principal parties participating in America’s politics: The implementation in the U.S. of a universal, free healthcare plan. Having experinced first-hand (with my father (RIP)) a free Social Security Health Plan in Spain, my native country, I could not understand why Americans were so worried abou the costs of such a Plan, a basic benefit for the residents of most occidental countries. The two main political parties in the U.S.A. seem to have forgotten that they exist mainly to ensure the happiness and well-being of the citizens and residents of America, nothing else. In that regard, questioning ‘who would pay for it’ (a free, universal access, Heathcare Plan), does not make any sense, when you see, for instance, some of the retired seniors in the country, struggling to pay for their health, or for their medicines, with their meager pensions, does it? (we all get old!) With both, the House and the Senate in his favor, Biden will have an historic opportunity to order the implementation of a free universal access Healthcare for all residents of America, even if he oppossed it in the past. There is nothing better he can do for Americans. Nothing better for his legacy. I hope he does it.
